newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ debt mkts rally on surprisingly weak CPI data.
newsitem.headline: NZ debt mkts rally on surprisingly weak CPI data.

text.p: * NZ short end rallies 15 basis points on weak CPI data
* Bonds rally to a lesser extent
* Market awaits RBNZ calculation of underlying inflation
New Zealnd debt markets rallied on Tuesday following the release of what dealers said was surprisingly weak March quarter Consumer Price Index data.

The 90-day bank bill rate fell about 15 basis points to 7.40 percent while bond yields were about six to seven points lower after Statistics New Zealand said the CPI fell 0.3 percent in the March quarter for a 1.8 percent rise in the March year.
"It was lower than market expectations," a dealer said of the CPI.
Analysts predicted the Reserve Bank, due to announce its calculation of underlying inflation data shortly, was likely to ease monetary conditions following the numbers.
